2.  Licenses issued under this article shall not be transferable to any other person and the business may be conducted only at the location for which the license is issued. 
C.  Posting. Every owner or operator of a public roller skating rink shall post his license in a conspicuous place in the hall where such roller skating is held. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 322-1981) 
111.461 - Inspection-Compliance. 
    No license for a roller skating rink shall be issued unless the owner of the rink complies with and conforms to the ordinances and health and fire regulations of the City and unless such rink is a safe and proper place for the purpose for which it is to be used. As a prerequisite to the issuance of a license, an inspection shall be made of the premises by the Fire Division and the Public Health Department. An approval must be had from each of such agencies. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 127-1991; Ord. 322-1981) 
111.462 - Revocation. 
    The license issued for any public roller skating rink may be revoked by the Mayor or his designated representative for the violation of any of the provisions of this article or for disorderly or immoral conduct upon the premises, subject to the provisions of  110.02. 
(Ord. 322-1981) 
111.463 - Sunday operations-Proximity to schools. 
A.  No person shall cause or permit a hall, room, rink, or ground used for roller skating by the public to be used for the purpose of roller skating by the public on Sunday between the hours of 2:30 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. 
B.  No person shall cause or permit a hall, room, rink, or ground used for roller skating by the public to be located closer than one hundred feet to any church or school. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 322-1981) 
Article 28. - Rubbish Haulers 

111.470 - Definitions. 
    For the purpose of this article the following definition shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning. 
    "Garbage." The matter, substance, or waste resulting from the growing, handling, storage, preparation, cooking, or consumption of food, including animals (including fat and bones), fowl, fish, fruits, and vegetables, including animal and bird feeds. 
    "Rubbish." Combustible and noncombustible waste materials except garbage collected from buildings or premises used for residence purposes. The term includes paper, rags, cartons, boxes, wood, sawdust, excelsior, rubber, leather, tree branches, yard trimmings, tin cans, metals, mineral matter, glass, crockery, dust, and the residue from the burning of wood, coal, coke, and other combustible materials. 
(Ord. 905-1985; Ord. 1502-1964) 
111.471 - License. 
A.  Required-Tags. 
1.  No person shall engage in the business of hauling rubbish or garbage within the corporate limits of the City unless he first obtains a license therefor from the Mayor or his designee. 
2.  Upon the issuance of such license, the applicant shall receive a metal tag which shall be attached in a conspicuous place upon the outer left side of each vehicle used for such purpose and which shall not be obscured in any manner. 
B.  Fee. The Mayor or his designee shall collect a fee of twenty-five dollars annually for each vehicle operated in the business of collecting and transporting rubbish and garbage. 
C.  Revocation. The license required by subsection A of this section may be revoked by the Mayor if the holder thereof violates any of the provisions of this article or the regulations promulgated pursuant to this article, subject to the provisions of  110.02. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 733-1994; Ord. 905-1985; Ord. 826-1983; Ord. 1522-1964; Ord. 1064-1961) 
111.472 - Insurance. 
    No license shall be issued until satisfactory evidence is furnished to the Mayor that there is in full force and effect a policy of public liability insurance in an amount of not less than one hundred thousand dollars for personal injury to one person, three hundred thousand dollars for personal injury to more than one person, and twenty-five thousand dollars for damage to property. Such policy of insurance shall be of not less than one year duration, and shall provide that it shall not be cancelled or revoked until ten days written notice of intention to cancel or revoke has been given to the City License Clerk. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 826-1983; Ord. 1064-1961) 
111.473 - Places of deposit-Charges. 
A.  Until such time as the City's recycle energy plant begins accepting rubbish for disposal, no rubbish shall be deposited by the holder of a rubbish hauler's license within the corporate limits of the City except at a place designated in writing by the Mayor. From and after the date on which such plant begins accepting rubbish for disposal, all rubbish collected within the corporate limits of the City by a holder of a rubbish hauler's license shall be deposited at such plant, provided that rubbish which is not acceptable for disposal by such plant shall not be deposited within the City except at a place designated in writing by the Mayor. 
B.  In the event that the Mayor designates to holders of rubbish haulers' licenses that rubbish hauled, and from and after the date referred to in subsection A of this section, rubbish not acceptable for disposal at the City's recycle energy plant, shall be deposited at a sanitary landfill site operated by the city, or at a site being operated under agreement with the city, then such rubbish hauler shall pay to the City a fee for each load of rubbish so deposited, according to a schedule of charges prescribed by the Mayor. The charges prescribed by the Mayor shall be of such amount as to reimburse the City for the cost incurred in disposing of the rubbish so deposited. 
C.  The Mayor is hereby authorized to promulgate such rules and regulations as may be required to carry out the intent of this section. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 841-1976) 
111.474 - Vehicles. 
A.  No person shall transport swill, garbage, fat, bones, offal, or any decayed, putrid, or stinking animal or vegetable matter, or the decayed, putrid carcass of any fowl or animal, or any street or alley except in vehicles of packer-type construction, barrels, or other receptacles that are effectively covered and watertight, so that no odors or liquids escape therefrom. 
B.  Each vehicle used in the collection and transporting of garbage collected at commercial and retail establishments shall be subject to annual inspections by the Director of Public Service or his agent. 
C.  Any person who is the owner of a vehicle, whether or not the owner is the operator, shall provide a tarp or other effective covering for use in the transporting of refuse or litter so that the refuse or litter shall not escape the vehicle. 
1.  Any person who is the operator of a vehicle employed for use in the transportation of refuse or litter, shall completely cover the refuse or litter so as to prevent any of the refuse or litter from falling from the vehicle and onto the streets of the city. 
2.  The operator shall employ only such a vehicle as has a bed or body solidly constructed so as to prevent any refuse or litter from falling from that vehicle and onto the streets of the city. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 684-1984; Ord. 112-1965; Ord. 1064-1961) 
111.475 - Compliance. 
    No license shall be issued under the provisions of this article until the License Clerk is satisfied, after inspection, that the vehicle sought to be licensed complies in all respects with the provisions of  111.474. The License Clerk may at any time call for reinspection of any vehicle for which a license has been issued. 
(Ord. 1064-1961) 
111.476 - Prohibited deposits. 
    No fruit, vegetable, meat, fowl, fish, or other food products or other garbage, whether mixed with rubbish or otherwise, shall be deposited or placed at such places designated for rubbish, nor shall any explosive substance or solvent or derivative thereof be deposited anywhere within the city. Penalty, see  111.999. 
111.477 - Exceptions. 
    The provisions of this article shall not apply to the hauling of ashes or cinders when they are unmixed with rubbish, such as used tin cans, boxes, and other like substances, or with any of the objectionable substances specified in  111.476. 
111.478 - Duty to report customers. 
    The holder of a license shall, at such times and in such forms as the Director of Public Service may direct, submit to the City a certified list of all customers that such license holder services whose properties are covered properties which would otherwise participate in the City's universal garbage and rubbish collection pursuant to  111.184. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 1003-1978) 
Article 29. - Secondhand Dealers 

111.490 - Secondhand dealers generally-License required. 
A.  For purposes of this article: 
    "Pawnbroker" means a person engaged in the business of lending money on deposit or pledges of personal property, other than securities or printed evidence of indebtedness, at a total charge, rate of interest, or discount or other remuneration in excess of eight per cent annum. 
    "Secondhand" means that which has been used or which has been previously traded or sold by a retailer. 
    "Selling" includes sale on consignment, delivery, barter, exchange, gift or offer thereof. 
    " Secondhand dealer " means any person, persons, society, club, partnership, organization or corporation engaged in the business of selling secondhand articles or purchasing secondhand articles for the purpose of resale. 
B.  No person, partnership, corporation, or other entity, unless duly licensed as provided in this article, shall engage in the business of a pawnbroker or the business of purchasing, selling, or receiving the following "secondhand articles": 
1.  Secondhand furs; 
2.  Secondhand typewriters, adding machines, check protectors, computers, laptops, printers, copiers, or other office machinery; 
3.  Pawnbrokers' tickets or other evidence of pledged articles; or 
4.  Secondhand tools of artisans, mechanics, or common laborers; 
5.  Secondhand cameras; 
6.  Secondhand musical instruments or equipment, amplifiers, mixing boards, etc.; 
7.  Secondhand precious stones or jewels, or manufactured articles composed wholly or in part of gold, silver, platinum, or other precious metal or precious alloys; or 
8.  Secondhand televisions, video monitors, record players, tape players, tape recorders, disc players or other stereo equipment, compact disks, portable music players, headphones, tablets, video cassette recorders or other video equipment, video game systems or other video game equipment, video game cartridges or video game compact disks, cellular telephones, radio receivers or transmitters, or other electronic media, toys, or devices; 
9.  Secondhand bicycles, athletic equipment, sporting goods, or fitness machinery or equipment; or 
10.  Secondhand retailer gift cards or store credit; or 
11.  Secondhand antique china, antique flatware or servingware; or 
12.  Secondhand weapons (except firearms), propane tanks, automobile parts, or yard equipment; or 
13.  Coins; or 
14.  Secondhand furniture, household appliances, or furnishings; or 
15.  Any other secondhand item that was issued or contains a serial number, including but not limited to designer items such as handbags and leather goods. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 204-1999; Ord. 34-1998; Ord. 376-1993; Ord. 54-1988; Ord. 262-1981) 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
111.491 - License application requirements. 
A.  Every applicant for a license shall make an application in writing to the License Clerk, which application shall set forth the name under which the business is to be conducted, the name of every person owning or having an interest in the business, the name of any person to be employed in the business, the location where the business is to be conducted, and the type of articles to be purchased, sold, or exchanged. The application must be made by the person who is to conduct the business and must contain references from at least two residents of the City as to the character of the applicant. 
B.  No license shall be issued to any applicant if the applicant, any of the persons owning or having an interest in the business, or any employee of the business has been convicted of any felony or any crime involving fraud, theft, receiving or possessing stolen property in the five years immediately preceding the date of the license application. The License Clerk shall not issue a license until thirty days have passed from the date of the application so that the License Clerk can thoroughly check the background and character of those persons as required by this article. 
C.  Subsection B of this section shall not apply to those applicants who are duly licensed under the provisions of this article at the time of their application. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 262-1981) 
111.492 - Inspections and tests of weights and measures. 
    Every applicant for a secondhand dealer license who intends to trade in precious stones or any manufactured article composed wholly or in part of gold, silver, platinum, or other precious metal must obtain an inspection and test from the Division of Weights and Measures of any and all scales, balances, or other instruments and devices for weighing and measuring, and any appliances and accessories associated with any or all such instruments and devices used at the location indicated on the application. The License Clerk must receive a certification from the Weights and Measures Superintendent that the required inspection and testing has taken place and that the scales, balances, instruments, devices, appliances, and accessories give a correct weight. The License Clerk shall not grant the application without the proper certification. The certification issued by the Weights and Measures Superintendent is valid only for the location indicated on the application. It is not transferable to any other person, partnership, corporation, or any other entity. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 54-1988; Ord. 262-1981) 
111.493 - License fee-Term. 
    The license fee, payable to License Clerk at the time of application, shall be fifty dollars for each business location. This fee which is paid at the time of application is not refundable in any case. The license shall expire annually on December 31. The license shall contain the name under which the business is to be conducted and the location where the business is to be conducted. 
(Ord. 319-1981; Ord. 262-1981) 
111.494 - License transfer-Display. 
    Licenses issued under this article shall not be transferable to any person, partnership, corporation, or other entity and the business may be conducted only at the location for which the license is issued. The license must be so placed as to be made conspicuously visible. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 262-1981) 
111.495 - Change in ownership, interest, or employees. 
    Every licensee, under the provisions of this article, shall inform the License Clerk in writing, within five days of any change in persons owning or having an interest in the business or persons employed in the business. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 262-1981) 
111.496 - License revocation and suspension. 
    The conviction of any licensee under the provisions of this article, any person owning or having an interest in the business, or any employee of a business licensed under this article, for any felony or for any crime involving fraud, theft, receiving, or possessing stolen property or for violation of any provision of this article shall constitute grounds for immediate revocation by the Mayor or his designated representative of the license issued to such business, subject to the provisions of  110.02. 
(Ord. 262-1981) 
111.497 - Record books. 
    Every licensee under the provisions of this article shall keep an electronic, printed, or written record, in English, which shall record the receipt of any secondhand article described in Section 111.490(B), an accurate description thereof, the price paid the seller therefor, the age, address, name, and a physical description (including height, weight, and hair color) of the person from whom such purchase was made, the date and hour of the purchase, the driver's license number or state identification card number, or other personal identification of the seller. The book shall at all times be open to the inspection of any member of the Police Division or the Mayor or his or her designee. Entries therein shall be consecutively numbered and shall not be erased, obliterated, altered, defaced, or removed. Copies of these records shall be made available upon request of any member of the Police Division or the Mayor or his designee. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 376-1993; Ord. 54-1988; Ord. 262-1981) 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
111.498 - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ord. 395-2015,  1, adopted Dec. 7, 2015, repealed  111.498, which pertained to police forms and derived from Ord. 262-1981; and Ord. 376-1993. 
111.499 - Tagging articles. 
    Every licensee under the provisions of this article, at the time of acquiring through purchase or exchange any secondhand article, shall attach a tag with a designating number thereon, legibly printed, in ink, in the English language, to each article, and shall make an entry of such number in the book provided in  111.497. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 262-1981) 
111.500 - Change or removal of articles. 
A.  No licensee under the provisions of this article or agent or employee thereof shall disassemble, take apart, change the form of, sell, or remove from the corporation limits of the City any of the goods, articles, or things sold to him, which are set forth in  111.490(B) until the same have been in his possession at least fourteen days. Notwithstanding the fourteen-day holding period a pawnshop may release a pawned item to the pawner in accord with state law prior to fourteen days from receipt of the item. 
B.  Any of the goods, articles, or things which are set forth in  111.490(B) in the possession of any licensee under the provisions of this article, shall be made available at any time for inspection by any member of the Police Division. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 376-1993; Ord. 54-1988; Ord. 262-1981) 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
111.501 - Purchases from minors-Hours of operation. 
A.  No person shall receive, by sale, barter, exchange, or otherwise, any article mentioned in this article from a minor under the age of eighteen years. Whenever a secondhand dealer has reason to know or believe the seller, purchaser or exchanger is under eighteen years of age, he or she must require that person to produce sufficient articles of identification to establish his or her age. Penalty, see  111.999. 
B.  There shall not be any purchase from any person or persons between the hours of 11:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m. on every day of the week. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 262-1981) 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
111.502 - Advertisement. 
    No business licensed under the provisions of this article shall be advertised through the use of any medium, without including within such advertisement the license number from the license received from the License Clerk. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 262-1981) 
111.503 - Exceptions. 
    The article shall not apply to: 
1.  Persons who deal exclusively in furniture; or 
2.  Persons who deal exclusively in secondhand automobiles; or 
3.  Persons who deal exclusively in clothing, except furs or leather; or 
4.  Transactions of five or fewer compact disks, video game cartridges and/or video game compact disks when store credit, and not money, is given for these items; or 
5.  Infrequent sales conducted as garage sales held in accordance with the provisions of Section 153.265 of this Code; or 
6.  Sales by religious or 501(C)(3) Charitable Organizations. 
(Ord. 403-1998; Ord. 376-1993; Ord. 576-1993; Ord. 262-1981) 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
111.504 - Reporting to LeadsOnline or similar entity. 
A.  The City of Akron Police Department shall enter into a contract for services and maintain its contract for services with LeadsOnline or a similar entity in order to enhance its investigative services to protect both secondhand dealers and members of the general public. In the event of a change to its electronic reporting system, the City shall notify all licensed secondhand dealers in the City of the change within a reasonable time prior to such change. 
B.  Every secondhand dealer shall own, operate or maintain reliable access to a functioning computer system with internet access for the purposes described herein. Every secondhand dealer shall subscribe to LeadsOnline or the City's current electronic reporting system and maintain said subscription throughout the term of the secondhand dealer's license. 
C.  Every secondhand dealer shall furnish a report of any and every secondhand article, as described in Section 111.490(B), taken in pawn, purchased, or otherwise accepted by such secondhand dealer as soon as reasonably possible after the transaction is consummated, but no later than the following calendar day, by uploading such report to the LeadsOnline program or the electronic system then in use by the City via a secure internet connection. For every report, the secondhand dealer shall input information to every data field supported by the LeadsOnline system or the system then currently in use by the Akron Police Division. No entry into the system shall be erased or tampered with by the secondhand dealer or any person. 
D.  No item shall be received or accepted unless the person from whom the article is acquired exhibits a driver's license or state-issued identification card and the identifying numbers are recorded on the electronic report submitted to LeadsOnline or the electronic system then in use by the city. 
E.  If any article that is left on deposit, pledged or purchased has engraved thereon a number, word or initials or contains settings of any kind, the description of the article in the electronic report shall contain the number, word or initials engraved and shall describe the setting of the item and the number of each kind. 
F.  Every secondhand dealer shall furnish a photograph of every article of jewelry, precious metal, or stone, regardless of value, taken in pawn, purchased or accepted by such secondhand dealer, as soon as reasonably possible after the transaction is consummated, but no later than the following calendar day, by uploading the photograph to the LeadsOnline or other program via a secure internet connection. 
G.  In the event the electronic reporting system malfunctions or is otherwise not operational, the secondhand dealer shall, at all times during such malfunction or non-operation, keep written records of any and all transactions that would have otherwise been entered in the electronic reporting system and shall submit such records to the Akron Police Division within twenty-four (24) hours of such transaction during the nonoperational period. The written records shall contain all information required on the electronic reporting system. 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
111.505 - Investigation by police. 
A.  If any City Law Enforcement Officer has probable cause to believe that the item(s) described in the reports provided for under this chapter is stolen property, the City Law Enforcement Officer shall notify the secondhand dealer in writing, and upon receipt of such notice, the secondhand dealer shall retain such item(s) until the expiration a reasonable period of time to conduct an investigation has elapsed, such time shall not be less than thirty (30) days after the day on which the secondhand dealer is first required to make available the information required in the daily list provided for under this chapter, unless the City Law Enforcement Officer notifies the secondhand dealer in writing that retention is not required until such expiration. 
B.  Every secondhand dealer shall immediately report to the Akron Police Division any article or thing pledged or sold to her; or which is sought to be pledged or sold to her, if she has reason to believe that the article or thing was stolen or lost. 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
111.506 - Identity of seller or pawner. 
A.  No person shall sell, exchange or pawn a secondhand article on behalf of another person without providing the name, residence or street address, and birth date of the person for whom the item is being exchanged, pawned or sold. 
B.  No person shall sell, exchange, or pawn a secondhand article on behalf of another person if the person for whom the item being pawned is not eligible to conduct the exchange, pawn or sale or to conceal that the item is or may be stolen. 
C.  No person shall use or provide a fictitious or false name or address, or provide false or fictitious information when selling, pledging, or exchanging any secondhand article with a secondhand dealer. 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
111.507 - Secondhand articles with unique identifiers. 
    No secondhand dealer shall purchase, trade, or accept for pawn any secondhand article known to be manufactured with a serial number or similar identifier if the serial number or other identifier has been altered, obstructed or removed. 
(Ord. 395-2015) 
Article 30. - Septic Tank Cleaners, Scavengers, and Industrial Waste Cleaners 

111.510 - Definitions. 
    For the purpose of this article the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning. 
    "Biochemical oxygen demand" or "BOD." The quantity of oxygen utilized in the biochemical oxidation of organic matter under standard laboratory procedure in five days at twenty degrees Celsius, expressed in milligrams per liter. 
    "City sewer system." All facilities required to provide sewer service within or from the geographical area served by the City as required by the Federal EPA pursuant to Public Law 92-500, subsequent amendments, if any, and any other legal requirements. 
    "Filter cake sludge." Treatment plant sludges originating at sewage treatment plants. 
    "Industrial waste cleanings." All wastes other than domestic wastes which are acceptable discharges and includes filter cake sludge. 
    "Scavenging cleaning." Those domestic wastes, other than those from septic tank cleaning, which are acceptable discharges. 
    "Septic tank cleaning." Those wastes removed from a septic tank or other tank which is designed to retain settled sewage solids long enough for satisfactory bacterial decomposition of the solids to take place, primarily by anaerobic bacterial action. This term does not include filter cake sludge herein defined. 
    "Suspended solids" or "SS." Total suspended matter that either floats on the surface of, or is in suspension in, water, wastewater, or other liquid, and that is removable by laboratory filtering as prescribed in "Standard Methods for the Examination of Water and Wastewater" and referred to as nonfilterable residue. 
    "Unacceptable discharges." All items enumerated under  111.512 which the Director of Public Service determines shall not be discharged to the City sewer system as required by the Federal EPA pursuant to Public Law 92-500, subsequent amendments, if any, and any other legal requirements. 
(Ord. 270-1982; Ord. 940-1976) 
111.511 - Discharge locations and methods. 
A.  Acceptable discharges, which are comprised of all items enumerated under  111.512 which have not been designated unacceptable discharges, shall be discharged in the City sewer system only at those locations and under those conditions and methods specifically designated by the Director of Public Service. 
B.  Each tank truck or other vehicle shall be so equipped as to permit emptying the contents of the tank truck or other vehicle into the City sewer system through a hose submerged at the end in the sewer flow, and no person shall empty a tank truck or other vehicle into the City sewer system in any other manner. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 270-1982; Ord. 940-1976) 
111.512 - Septic tank cleaning, scavenging cleaning, and industrial waste cleaners. 
    No person shall empty or discharge septic tank cleanings, scavenging cleanings, wastes, waters, pollutants, industrial waste cleanings, filter cake sludge, or any other materials, substances, and gases, whether deemed acceptable or unacceptable discharges, into any manhole or other appurtenances of any sanitary, combined, or storm sewer, the Akron Water Pollution Control Station or into any watercourse within, flowing into, or under the jurisdiction of, the city, except as may be otherwise provided in this code, by applicable law, or by duly authorized agreements. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 270-1982; Ord. 940-1976) 
111.513 - Compliance required. 
    No person shall engage in the business of cleaning of, transporting of, disposal of, or any combination thereof of septic tank cleanings, scavenging cleanings, wastes, waters, pollutants, industrial waste cleanings, filter cake sludge, or any other materials, substances, and gases, whether deemed acceptable or unacceptable discharges in the city, or operate or maintain anywhere in the City any vehicle used for or in connection with such cleaning of, transporting of, or disposal of, or any combination thereof, except as may be otherwise provided in this code by applicable law, or by duly authorized agreements. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 270-1982; Ord. 940-1976) 
111.514 - License required. 
A.  1.  No person shall engage in the business of cleaning of septic tanks or transporting of, or disposal of, or any combination thereof of septic tank cleanings, scavenging cleanings, wastes, waters, pollutants, industrial waste cleanings, filter cake sludge, or any other materials, substances, and gases, whether deemed acceptable or unacceptable discharges, or operate or maintain anywhere in the City any vehicle used for or in connection with such cleaning of, transporting of, or disposal of, or any combination thereof, of aforesaid enumerated items, without first obtaining a license therefor from the License Clerk to whom shall be paid the following license fee which shall be in addition to the rates charged in  111.517. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no such license shall be required for such a vehicle which is operated from a business location, office, or headquarters outside of the City and is transporting septic tank cleanings, scavenging cleanings, wastes, waters, pollutants, industrial waste cleanings, filter cake sludge, or any other materials, substances, and gases whether deemed acceptable or unacceptable discharges to a location not connected to the sewerage system of the City or is passing through and has no destination in the City or to the City sewer system. This does not preclude the absolute banning from the City of any of the aforesaid enumerated items where the presence of a particular item constitutes a clear and present danger to the health or safety of the citizens of the city. 
2.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, those substances deemed unacceptable discharges shall not be discharged anywhere into the City sewer system. Accordingly, the rates charged under  111.517 shall not apply to those loads which are prohibited from discharge into the City sewer system. However, the annual license fee shall apply and the advance deposit fee may apply if the Director of Public Service deems such fee is required to enforce the requirement that unacceptable discharges shall not be discharged anywhere into the City sewer system. 
3.  No such license shall be required where a vehicle is rendering assistance to Akron Water Pollution Control Station or other appurtenances of the City sewer system at the request of the Director of Public Service in the case of a major catastrophe or emergency. 
a.  The annual license fee for each person so engaged in septic tank cleaning, scavenging cleaning, industrial waste cleaning or filter cake sludge cleaning shall be fifty dollars for each tank truck or other vehicle operated plus an advance deposit fee to insure payment of the rates set forth in  111.517. The license fee and advance deposit fee shall be payable in advance on or before July 1 of each year. 
b.  The advance deposit fee shall be in accordance with the following: For each truck or vehicle licensed, the advance deposit fee shall be one hundred dollars for each one thousand gallons capacity or fraction thereof. Capacity shall be determined by the Director of Public Service. 
B.  Any advance deposit fee remaining at June 30 of the following year after payment of all fees, charges, fines, under  111.999, and rates shall be either refunded or credited to the advance deposit fee for the subsequent year beginning July 1. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 270-1982; Ord. 940-l976) 
111.515 - License revocation. 
    Licenses may be revoked by the Director of Public Service for failure to comply with any requirement of this article, subject to the provisions of  110.02. 
111.516 - Regulations-Insurance. 
    License holders shall carry public liability insurance of no less than five hundred thousand dollars/one million dollars, property damage insurance of no less than two hundred fifty thousand dollars with the City as a named insured and such other insurance subject to the approval of the Director of Public Service, maintain suitable equipment in good repair with such tags or discernible markings as prescribed by the Director and follow such methods of operation as prescribed by the Director of Public Service and also follow such methods of operation as are prescribed by regulations prepared by the Director of Public Service and approved by the Director of Health if such approval is required. A license from the Summit County Health Department or other health department having jurisdiction may be required by the Director of Public Service as a condition precedent to the issuance of a license under this article. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 270-1982; Ord. 940-1976) 
111.517 - Rates applicable to acceptable discharges to the City sewer system and payment of fees, charges, fines, and rates. 
A.  1.  The rates shall be based upon: 
a.  The amount of property devoted to or required to be available to treat acceptable discharges enumerated under  111.512; 
b.  Operating, maintaining, and replacement costs consistent with Federal EPA requirements so that the treatment of acceptable discharges referred to herein shall be paid for on a proportionate basis; and 
c.  All other costs required to provide service plus a return on the capital of the sewer system devoted in whole or in part to provide service herein. 
2.  The derived rates shall reflect the cost of service subject to continuing Federal EPA requirements and to provide a return on capital and other costs outside EPA requirements. 
3.  The derived rates shall be recalculated on or before May 1 of 1982, and each year thereafter based on the prior calendar year adjusted to normalize costs and the new calculated rates shall thereafter be effective on July 1 of the particular year. 
4.  The rates and revised rates shall be determined on a continuing basis under the jurisdiction of the Director of Public Service. 
B.  1. The rates effective May 1, 1982, through June 30, 1983, and subject to annual revisions thereafter based on May 1 calculations for septic tank cleanings are: 
a. $6.59 per one thousand gallons of acceptable septic tank discharges delivered to the WPCS at the location designated by the Director of Public Services and based on BOD cost per one thousand gallons. b. 6.72 per one thousand gallons of acceptable septic tank discharges delivered to the WPCS at the location designated by the Director of Public Services and based on SS cost per one thousand gallons. c. 6.09 per one thousand gallons for all other costs related to the cost of service not reflected in the rates for BOD and SS. Total For Rate $19.40 Subject to revision each year but to be no less than $19.40 per one thousand gallons.  
2.  The initial rates effective May 1, 1982, through June 30, 1983, and subject to annual revisions thereafter based on May 1 calculations for scavenging cleaning, industrial waste cleaning, and filter cake sludge are: 
a. $29.01 for BOD and SS costs for each one thousand gallons or wet ton of filter cake. b.   6.09 for other costs related to cost of service for each one thousand gallons or wet ton of filter cake. Total For Initial Rate $35.10 per one thousand gallons or one wet ton of filter cake each year.  
3.  Rates or charges shall he established in addition to the aforementioned rates which shall reflect the additional costs required for acceptable discharges or the handling of filter cake sludge, if acceptable to the city, which items thereby require special handling or special treatment or use of additional facilities of the City sewer system, or any combination thereof, not reflected in the rates under subsections (B)(1)(a), (b), and (c) or (B)(2) (a) and (b) of this section. 
C.  All persons using the City sewer system shall pay the appropriate fees, charges, fines, and rates in such amounts, at such times, and in such manner as established either under this code or by the Director of Public Service. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 270-1982; Ord. 940-1976) 
Article 31. - Shooting Galleries 

111.530 - License. 
A.  Required. No person shall operate or maintain a shooting gallery or place wherein firearms are discharged at targets within this City for profit or commercial purposes without first making application to the License Clerk for a license for each establishment so operated or maintained. 
B.  Application-Inspection of Premises and Firearms. Upon application by any person for a license to operate or maintain any shooting gallery, the Superintendent of Building Inspection shall first make an inspection of the premises to be used as a shooting gallery and shall determine the fitness and suitability of such gallery, and the Chief of Police shall cause the firearms and equipment used in such shooting galleries to be regularly and frequently inspected, with full consideration of the public safety and welfare. 
C.  Fee-Term-Transfer. 
1.  The license fee, payable to the License Clerk at the time of application, shall be seventy-five dollars. This fee which is paid at the time of application is not refundable in any case. On approval of the application by the Mayor, the License Clerk shall issue a license to the applicant. The license shall expire annually on December 31. 
2.  Licenses issued under this article shall not be transferable to any other person and the business may be conducted only at the location for which the license is issued. 
D.  Revocation. The Mayor may revoke any licenses issued under the provisions of this article without refund of fees if it appears that the operation or maintenance of any gallery constitutes a menace or endangers the public welfare, health, or safety, subject to the provisions of  110.02. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 323-1981) 
111.531 - Insurance. 
    No license shall be issued under the provisions of this article unless and until the applicant delivers to the License Clerk a policy of liability insurance, or a certificate of insurance evidencing the issuance thereof, in an amount of one hundred thousand dollars covering the operation of each place of business where a shooting gallery is operated or maintained, such policy to insure the City as an additional insured. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 323-1981) 
111.532 - Hours of operation. 
    No owner or operator of a shooting gallery shall permit the same to be or remain open or permit any person to be in the shooting gallery between the hours of 12:00 midnight and 5:00 a.m. of any day in the week, or all day on Sunday. Penalty, see  111.999. 
111.533 - Exceptions. 
    The provisions of this article shall not apply to or affect bona fide private shooting clubs operating on a nonprofit or noncommercial basis; nor shall the provisions of this article prohibit or preclude any such bona fide private shooting clubs from promoting and giving entertainments or private shooting contests for prizes wherein the public is invited for an admission fee, for the purpose of maintaining and furthering the interests of such club and its members. 
Article 32. - Taxicabs and Transportation Services 

111.540 - Definitions. 
    For the purpose of this article the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning. 
A.  " Street ." Any public or private street, alley, or public way within the corporate limits of the City. 
B.  " Taxicab ." All motor-driven vehicles engaged in the business of carrying passengers for hire or fare for operating within the City, including anyone offering rides for free and accepting tips. 
C.  " Taxicab company ." Every corporation, company, association, joint stock association, person, firm, or partnership or their lessees, trustees, receivers, or trustees appointed by any court, owning, controlling, operating, maintaining or managing one or more taxicabs within the City. 
D.  " Taxicab driver ." Any person who drives or operates a taxicab and who is in actual physical control of a taxicab on the streets of the City. 
E.  " Transportation company ." Every corporation, company, association, joint stock association, person, firm, or partnership or their lessees, trustees, receivers, and trustees appointed by any court owning, controlling, operating, or managing any vehicle engaged in the business of transporting persons for hire or fare within the City. 
F.  This chapter does not apply to the following: motor buses on regular schedules, Metro Regional Transit Authority vehicles and other vehicles on regularly established routes; taxicabs and motor vehicles owned, regulated or operated by a taxing authority or district of the State of Ohio; motor vehicles used exclusively as hearses or ambulances or exclusively for service at weddings, christenings, funerals, or other similar special occasions; motor vehicles leased or rented for private use without the service of a chauffeur or driver; motor vehicles properly licensed by the state of Ohio as limousines or livery vehicles as long as the vehicles are operating within the laws of Ohio as limousines and are only picking up passengers on prearranged contracts made in advance of boarding. If the limousine is picking up passengers without prearranged contracts, the vehicle is operating as a taxicab. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.541 - Compliance required. 
    No taxicab company, taxicab driver, transportation company or transportation driver shall operate any taxicab or transportation service within the City except in accordance with the provisions of this chapter. Each taxicab or transportation company shall provide taxicab or transportation service throughout the City. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.542 - Authority of licensing agent. 
    The licensing agent or person designated by the licensing agent shall have the authority to supervise and regulate the operation of all taxicabs and transportation companies, and prescribe rules and regulations and issue orders in conformity with the provisions of this chapter. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.543 - Taxicab and transportation company license, requirements and license fee. 
A.  No taxicab company or transportation company shall pick up fares in the City of Akron, Ohio unless the company has been issued and maintains a valid license for each of its taxicabs or transportation vehicles. 
B.  Application. 
1.  A taxicab company or transportation company desiring to obtain a license shall make application to the licensing agent providing the following information: 
a.  Business name, business address, business email, and telephone number; 
b.  The make, license number, vehicle identification number (VIN) and seating capacity of each vehicle. 
c.  The names of all owners and the names of all drivers who will operate the taxicab(s) or transportation vehicle(s) and their home addresses. 
d.  A list of fares and rates to be charged passengers for transportation. Such list shall be re-filed with the licensing agent prior to the fares or rates being adjusted or changed. 
2.  The application shall be accompanied with proof of liability insurance with respect to all taxicab companies, taxicab drivers, transportation companies and transportation drivers and provide the following: 
a.  The policy shall be written by an insurance company authorized to carry on business and write such policies in the state. 
b.  For each taxicab or transportation driver, the liability insurance policy shall be a combined single limit policy of $500,000. 
c.  The policy shall contain a clause obligating the insured to give ten (10) days' written notice to the licensing agent before cancellation and a clause for the company's continuing liability thereunder for the full amount, notwithstanding any recovery thereon. Such policy or certificate shall list the manufacturer's serial number and the Ohio license plate number for each vehicle covered therein. The policy or certificate shall be re-filed with the licensing agent whenever any vehicle is deleted from the transportation service of the insured or a vehicle is added to the transportation service of the insured. 
d.  If, at any time in the judgment of the licensing agent the policy is not sufficient, the licensing agent may require the taxicab or transportation company to replace it with another. 
C.  All licensees shall immediately notify the licensing agent in person of any changes in the information included in the application for the license, including the names, home addresses and phone numbers of drivers and the deletion or addition of vehicles utilized in the transportation service. Vehicles may be substituted without payment of a license fee, but the addition of one or more vehicles shall require payment of a license fee for each such vehicle. 
D.  At the time of the issuance of the license, and annually thereafter, on or before June 30, the taxicab and transportation companies shall pay a fee of two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) to the licensing agent plus a license fee of twenty-five dollars ($25.00) per taxicab or transportation vehicle up to and including five (5) vehicles; twenty dollars ($20.00) per vehicle up to and including ten (10) vehicles; and fifteen dollars ($15.00) for each additional vehicle over ten (10). This fee shall be in addition to any other fees required by this chapter. 
E.  The issuance of any license by the City shall not in any manner be construed as authorizing or permitting the licensee to operate a taxicab company or transportation company in violation of any provision of this chapter. A taxicab or transportation company shall not permit any person to operate or drive for hire or fare any taxicab or transportation vehicle owned or operated by the company until the licensing agent has been notified of the driver's name and address and the driver has obtained a taxicab or transportation driver's license pursuant to section 111.544. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.544 - Taxicab and transportation driver's license. 
A.  No person shall operate a taxicab or transportation vehicle within the City without first obtaining a taxicab or transportation driver's license. 
B.  Qualifications. 
1.  An applicant for a taxicab or transportation driver's license must be at least twenty-one (21) years old. 
2.  An applicant must have a valid driver's license issued by the State of Ohio. 
3.  No applicant shall be issued a license under this chapter if he or she has been convicted of, or pled guilty to, any of the following criminal offenses: 
a.  Any homicide offense identified in Chapter 2903 of the Ohio Revised Code, or any substantially equivalent homicide offense under any federal, state or local law; 
b.  Any kidnapping offense identified in Chapter 2905 et seq. of the Ohio Revised Code, or any substantially equivalent kidnapping offense under any federal, state or local law; 
c.  Any sex offense set forth in Chapter 2907 of the Ohio Revised Code, or any substantially equivalent sex offense under any federal, state or local law. 
4.  No applicant shall be issued a license under this chapter if he or she has been convicted of, or pled guilty to, any of the following crimes within five (5) years of completion of sentence: 
a.  Unlawful possession of weapons, as defined in Section 2923.11 of the Ohio Revised Code or any substantially equivalent offense under federal, state or local law; 
b.  Any felony involving physical violence; 
c.  Driving under the influence of alcohol and/or a controlled substance. 
C.  A person desiring to obtain a taxicab or transportation drivers license shall make application in writing, under oath, to the licensing agent providing the following information: 
1.  Full name. 
2.  Place of residence and telephone number; place of residence for five (5) years preceding the date of such application, and place of birth. 
3.  Date of birth, sex, height, weight, color of eyes and hair, and citizenship. 
4.  Place of previous employment for the five (5) years preceding the date of application. 
5.  A valid drivers license issued by the State of Ohio. 
6.  Whether the applicant has been convicted of a felony or misdemeanor, and if so, when, where, what offense, and the sentence for each conviction. 
7.  Whether the applicant has previously been employed as a taxicab or transportation driver, and if so, when, where and by whom. 
8.  Whether the applicant has ever had a previous license denied, suspended, or revoked, and if so, where, when and for what reason. 
D.  Each application for a taxicab or transportation drivers license shall be accompanied by three (3) unmounted, unretouched photographs of the applicant, taken within thirty (30) days of the date of the application, suitable for attachment to the license. 
E.  Each driver shall keep his correct address and phone number on file with the licensing agent and shall notify the licensing agent if there is a change in address. 
(Ord. 381-1989; Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.545 - Licensing; expiration; renewal. 
A.  Upon satisfactory fulfillment of the requirements listed in Section 111.544 and payment of the license fee in the amount of twenty-five dollars ($25.00), the licensing agent shall issue to the applicant a taxicab or transportation services driver's license or renewal. 
B.  A taxicab or transportation drivers license shall expire on June 30 of each year. In the event an application for a new license is made on or after June 1 of any year, but not later than June 30 of the same year, such license shall be in force and effect to and including June 30 of the following year. 
C.  A driver, in applying for a renewal of the taxicab or transportation drivers license, shall make application before June l and provide the date when the original license was granted, the license number, and such other information as the licensing agent may require. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.546 - Display of license. 
    A certified copy of a taxicab or transportation company license and the City of Akron taxicab or transportation drivers license shall be exhibited in a prominent place in each taxicab or transportation services vehicle at all times. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.547 - Licenses not transferable. 
    Any person acquiring a licensed taxicab or transportation vehicle shall at the time of acquisition acquire a license in such person's name as the new owner. Taxicab and transportation licenses are not transferable. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.548 - Taxicab and transportation vehicle standards. 
A.  No person shall knowingly permit the operation of a taxicab or transportation vehicle unless it is equipped with the following: 
1.  A light within the passenger compartment. 
2.  Telephone service shall be available to each taxicab or transportation driver so that calls to emergency services such as police and fire departments can be made if needed. 
3.  Passenger restraints such as manufacturer-installed seatbelts or air bags, which may be used at the option of the passenger, numbering no fewer than the maximum occupancy of the cab or vehicle. 
4.  A suitable holder for the drivers identification card in a place where such card will be visible to the passengers at all times. 
B.  No person shall knowingly permit the operation of any taxicab or transportation vehicle which is in such unsafe condition as to endanger any person or property. 
C.  No person shall place any vehicle into service as a taxicab which does not have at least three (3) doors. No vehicle which requires the movement of a seat or any portion of a seat to gain access to other seating shall be placed into service as a taxicab. 
D.  No person shall allow the operation of any taxicab or transportation vehicle which does not comply with the standards established in this section. Failure to do so shall constitute grounds for revocation of such taxicab or transportation license. 
E.  Taxicabs and transportation vehicles shall be tobacco smoke free. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.549 - Vehicle safety inspections. 
A.  No owner or other person having possession or control of any taxicab or transportation vehicle shall operate the same upon the streets unless such vehicle has an unexpired seal of inspection issued by the Ohio State Highway Patrol indicating that it has been duly inspected and found safe and roadworthy within the preceding twelve (12) months. 
B.  In lieu of an inspection by the Ohio State Highway Patrol, an owner may submit an affidavit satisfactory to the licensing agent certifying that each licensed vehicle is safe and roadworthy. 
C.  If any taxicab or transportation vehicle is damaged by reason of a collision or from any other cause, no owner or other person having possession or control thereof shall operate the same upon the streets unless such vehicle has been tested and approved by the Ohio State Highway Patrol within twenty-four (24) hours after such vehicle has been returned to service. 
D.  A violation of this section shall constitute grounds for revocation of such taxicab or transportation license. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.550 - Identification markings on taxicabs; inspections. 
A.  Each taxicab shall bear distinctive permanent identification markings as follows: 
1.  Rear. The rear part of each taxicab shall have painted, stenciled or decal transferred, the name of the company owning and operating the taxicab in letters approximately four inches (4") in height, and the number of the taxicab in letters approximately eight inches (8") in height. 
2.  Sides. Each side of each taxicab shall have painted, stenciled or decal transferred the name of the company owning and operating the taxicab and the maximum capacity of the taxicab in letters approximately five inches (5") in height, the number of such taxicab in letters approximately six inches (6") in height and the rate of fare, the numerals indicating the base rate of fare in letters approximately two inches (2") in height and the remaining portion of the legend in letters approximately one inch (1") in height. 
3.  Roof. An illuminated sign displaying the word "Taxi" to both the front and rear of the taxicab shall be mounted on the forward part of the roof. The sign shall be illuminated when the vehicle is on duty. Such sign shall be approximately twelve inches (12") in overall length. 
4.  Color. The color of such markings shall be adequately contrasting with the color of the vehicle to render them easily visible and legible. 
B.  The vehicle's Ohio vehicle registration plates shall be visible to the front and rear at all times. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.551 - Display of rates; excessive charges. 
    Every taxicab or transportation driver shall display, at all times, a printed list of the standard fares and rates to be charged passengers for transportation as required by section 111.543(B). No owner or driver shall charge any amount in excess of such printed rates unless by mutual agreement between the passenger and driver entered into before leaving the point of departure. 
(Ord. 68-1986) 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.552 - Prohibited acts. 
    Taxicab companies, taxicab drivers, transportation companies and transportation drivers are prohibited from causing or permitting the following acts in the use or operation of taxicabs or transportation vehicles: 
A.  To permit occupancy by more persons than the actual seating capacity of such vehicle as shown by the application filed with the licensing agent. 
B.  To drive a taxicab or transportation vehicle while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or drugs greater than the CDL BAC limit of .04 or to drink any intoxicating liquor or use any illegal drugs or hallucinogens whatsoever while engaged in driving or while on duty as a driver of any taxicab. 
C.  To fail, neglect or refuse to turn over to the taxicab company's officers within twenty-four (24) hours all lost articles found in any taxicab. 
D.  To fail to notify the police department about an accident within twelve (12) hours of its occurrence, upon a form provided by the police department, and/or provide any additional information which the licensing agent may desire regarding such accident. 
E.  To permit a full-time driver to work in excess of twelve (12) hours in any twenty-four (24) hour period. 
F.  To fail to transport passengers to requested destinations without just cause or to misrepresent the fare. 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.553 - Refusal, revocation or suspension of taxicab or transportation license. 
A.  The licensing agent is authorized to refuse to issue a taxicab or transportation company license or a taxicab or transportation drivers license upon good cause, and/or when the health, safety and/or welfare of prospective riders or the public require it. 
B.  Any taxicab or transportation license may be suspended or revoked at any time by the licensing agent for the violation of any provision of this chapter or for any reason which would be grounds for denial of an application. Any such suspension or revocation shall be noted on the taxicab or transportation license together with a statement of the reason therefore. 
C.  In the event of refusal, denial, suspension or revocation of a taxicab or transportation license, appeal may be taken pursuant to section 110.02. 
D.  A taxicab or transportation license which has been revoked shall not be reissued for one (1) year. 
E.  A determination of refusal, revocation or suspension of a taxicab or transportation license shall be a final decision, allowing all appropriate appeal to an appropriate court of law, pursuant to the Ohio Revised Code. 
F.  Any taxicab or transportation license may be suspended, revoked or denied approval if any information provided on any application form required under section 111.543 is determined to be false. 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.554 - Records; trip sheets. 
    The owner or the person in charge of one (1) or more taxicabs or transportation vehicles shall keep a record of all such taxicabs or transportation vehicles showing the body number, City taxicab or transportation driver's license number, and the vehicle license plate number, and such data as may be necessary to identify the driver of such vehicle at any and all times. Such owner or person in charge shall also keep a record of the time of departure from and arrival at his garage or headquarters of such taxicab, and the total fares charged. 
    Taxicab and transportation company owners shall require their drivers to submit completed trip sheets on a weekly basis. 
    All such records shall be maintained and not destroyed for a period of one (1) year, and shall be subject to inspection at all times by the police department and by the licensing agent, and the City of Akron's Income Tax Division or designee. 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
111.555 - Receipts for fares. 
    The owner, driver, or person in charge or control of a taxicab or other transportation vehicle shall deliver to the person paying for the hire of such vehicle, if requested by such person and at the time of payment of such fare, a receipt therefor, which receipt shall show if requested, the point where such person was accepted as a passenger and where discharged, the number of the vehicle and the name of the company operating the vehicle. 
(Ord. No. 193-2011,  1, 6-27-11) 
Article 33. - Day Labor Pool Temporary Employment Agencies 

111.560 - Definitions. 
    For the purposes of this subchapter, the following definitions shall apply unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning. 
    "Associate." Any person seeking or receiving work from a temporary employment agency. 
    "Day labor pool opportunities." Means, when, either at the option of the temporary employment agency or the associate, the associate seeks, or is offered, employment on a daily basis, or may be paid each day for the work he or she received that day through the temporary employment agency. 
    "Day labor pool temporary employment agency." Any temporary employment agency which offers on or before December 31 of each year "Day labor pool opportunities" to its associates. 
    "Licensing agent." Means the agent of the department of finance empowered by the Mayor to issue licenses. 
    "Temporary employment agency." Any operation run by an individual, corporation, business trust, estate, trust, partnership, or association which offers temporary employment opportunities. 
(Ord. 575-2003: Ord. 683-1998; Ord. 909-1997) 
111.561 - Licensing. 
A.  Requirement. No day labor pool temporary employment agency shall operate in the City without first obtaining a temporary employment agency license from the city. 
B.  Application. Any individual, corporation, business trust, estate, trust, partnership, or association seeking to operate a day labor pool temporary employment agency in the City may apply for a day labor pool temporary employment agency license through the office of the City Licensing Agent. The application shall set forth: 
1.  The name under which the business is to be conducted; 
2.  The location or locations where the business is to be operated; 
3.  The name and address of every person with an interest in the day labor pool temporary employment agency as follows: 
a.  A sole proprietorship, the name and address of that individual, 
b.  A firm of partnership, the names and addresses of each member of the firm or partnership, or 
c.  A corporation, the name and addresses of all officers and directors. 
C.  Submission. Along with a completed application, any individual, corporation, business trust, estate, trust, partnership or association seeking to operate a day labor pool temporary employment agency in the City shall submit to the office of the City Licensing Agent a certificate of insurance required by  111.564(A)(1). 
D.  Inspections. No license for a day labor pool temporary employment agency shall be issued until the facility is inspected and approved by the Department of Public Service. After these initial inspections, each facility shall be reinspected at least twice yearly. 
E.  Police Reports. The Licensing Agent shall obtain police reports regarding each licensed day labor pool temporary employment agency every six months and/or before renewing any day labor pool temporary employment agency license. 
(Ord. 683-1998; Ord. 909-1997) 
(Ord. No. 16-1010,  1, 1-25-10) 
111.562 - License periods and fees. 
A.  License Period. Day labor pool temporary employment agency licenses shall be issued for a period of one year, beginning January 1st of each year. 
B.  License Fees. Day labor pool temporary employment agency licenses shall be issued upon the payment of a non refundable license fee of two hundred dollars per location. 
(Ord. 62-2003; Ord. 683-1998; Ord. 909-1997) 
111.563 - License renewals and transfers. 
A.  Renewal. Thirty days prior to the expiration of each day labor pool temporary employment agency license, the licensing agent shall mail a license renewal notice to the licensee. The office of the Licensing Agent shall then issue a renewal license upon payment of a nonrefundable renewal license fee of two hundred dollars per location. 
B.  Transfers. No license for a day labor pool temporary employment agency may be transferred to a purchaser or lessor of a day labor pool temporary employment agency without verification to the office of the Licensing Agency that the purchaser or lessor acquired more than fifty percent of the value of the day labor pool temporary employment agency. 
(Ord. 683-1998; Ord. 909-1997) 
111.564 - Requirements for day labor pool temporary employment agencies. 
A.  Existing Agencies. All day labor pool temporary employment agencies shall by January 1, 1999: 
1.  Acquire and maintain liability insurance for the building and any surrounding area owned or leased by the day labor pool temporary employment agency in the minimum amount of one thousand dollars combined single limit for bodily injury, wrongful death or property from any one occurrence; 
2.  Not allow or permit disorderly conduct, or the possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages in its building or in the surrounding area owned or leased by the day labor pool temporary employment agency; 
3.  Post permanent signs at the inside of each entrance to the day labor pool temporary employment agency containing: 
a.  In letters and numbers not less than two inches in height, the days of operation and hours of operation of the temporary employment agency, and 
b.  In letters not less than three inches in height, the words "No disorderly conduct, or possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages allowed on these premises."; 
4.  By January 1, 1999, provide a minimum of two trash receptacles of at least thirty gallons in capacity for the day labor pool temporary employment agency's outdoors area if the temporary employment agency owns or leases outdoor areas surrounding the building from which it operates; 
5.  Maintain daily records of the number of associates served; 
6.  Install and maintain in proper working order at all times a video surveillance system designed to monitor the day labor pool temporary employment agency from at least two different locations on the day labor pool temporary employment agency site. In conjunction with this video surveillance requirement, a day labor pool temporary employment agency shall post signs at each entrance to its facility stating that the property is under video surveillance; 
7.  Install and maintain in proper working order at all times mercury vapor and/or high pressure sodium lighting at both the front and rear of the property on which the day labor temporary employment agency is located. 
B.  Future or Relocated Agencies. In addition to the requirements of subsection A of this section, any day labor pool temporary employment agency established or any current day labor pool temporary employment agency relocated in the City after December 15, 1997 shall: 
1.  Be located only in areas zoned U3, A4, U3, A5, or U4; 
2.  Not be located within five hundred feet of a school, public library, public playground, or an establishment with a liquor permit, church or single family residential area; 
3.  Provide a waiting room area for associates large enough to accommodate a permitted occupancy, as determined by the City Fire Code, equal to twenty-five percent of the average daily number or anticipated number of associates; 
4.  Provide a number of restroom facilities for associates equal to one for each one hundred of the average number of daily associates; 
5.  Provide parking in accordance with applicable requirements in Chapter 153; and 
6.  Be subject to a minimum of two inspections annually by the City Department of Public Service. 
(Ord. 683-1998; Ord. 909-1997) 
(Ord. No. 16-2010,  1, 1-25-10) 
111.565 - License suspension or revocation. 
A.  Grounds. A day labor pool temporary employment agency license may be revoked or suspended by the City Licensing Agent if the day labor pool temporary employment agency is found to be in violation of the requirements set forth in  111.564 of this code. Additionally, a day labor pool temporary employment agency license may be suspended or revoked if incident reports and/or citizen complaints filed by or with the Akron Police Department indicate that day labor pool temporary employment agency operation has become a threat or nuisance to the area surrounding the agency. 
B.  Notice. The City Licensing Agent, upon receipt of an alleged violation by or complaint about a day labor pool temporary employment agency, shall investigate that charge. If a police report was filed on the complaint or alleged violation and/or if the charge is substantiated, the licensing agent shall notify the day labor pool temporary employment agency of the specifics of the allegation, and the date and time of the public hearing held to examine the allegation. 
C.  Hearing. A grievance panel composed of five members: one community oriented policing services (COPS) officer appointed by the Chief of Police, one member of the Mayor's administration appointed by the Mayor and two members of the public at large appointed by the Mayor and one Council Member appointed by the President of Council shall, at the public hearing, hear all available evidence on the alleged violation by or complaint about the day labor pool temporary employment agency before making a decision on the violation or violations. 
D.  Decision. After the public hearing, the grievance panel shall determine whether the day labor pool temporary employment agency license should be suspended or revoked. Any day labor pool temporary employment agency whose license has been revoked shall immediately cease operations in the city. 
E.  Appeal. Decisions of the grievance panel concerning day labor pool temporary employment agency licenses shall constitute final appealable orders for the purposes of Revised Code Chapter 2506. 
(Ord. 112-2001; Ord. 683-1998; Ord. 909-1997) 
Article 34. - Theatrical Exhibitions and Shows 

111.570 - License required-Exceptions. 
    No person, firm, corporation, or partnership shall act, exhibit, play, or perform any farce, play, drama, comedy, opera, or other theatrical performance, circus, feats of horsemanship, menagerie, exhibition of animals, amusement house, haunted house, fun house, panorama, diorama, concert, or other exhibition, entertainment, show, moving picture show, or amusement of whatever name or nature for which money or other reward is in any manner demanded or received, without first obtaining a license therefor issued by the Mayor. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 630-1979) 
111.571 - License fees-Exceptions. 
A.  Each of the following license fees shall be paid to the License Clerk where applicable at the time of application: 
1.  For any amusement house, haunted house, or fun house-ten dollars per day or fifty dollars per week; 
2.  For any circus, show, menagerie, or combination thereof-fifty dollars per day; 
3.  For all other unspecified exhibitions of any kind whatsoever licensed under this article-fifty dollars per day; 
4.  The owner, lessee, or manager of any academy of music, public hall, or building used for any theatrical exhibition (live show) or other amusement or performance shall obtain an annual license from the License Clerk which shall expire on September 30 of each year. The fee shall be one hundred dollars per year or any part of a year. 
5.  The owner, lessee, or manager of any building used for a motion picture show shall obtain an annual license from the License Clerk which shall expire on September 30 of each year. The fee shall be one hundred dollars per year or any part of a year. 
B.  No license shall be issued to permit any circus, show, menagerie, or combination thereof to operate within the City for more than fourteen days in any calendar year, for the same sponsor. 
C.  No license shall be required for entertainments given by any public or private school, lectures on historical, literary, or scientific subjects or concerts, fairs, or exhibitions of paintings or statuary given or made by residents of the City for benevolent, religious, or charitable purposes. 
D.  The fees paid at the time of application under this article shall not be refundable for any reason. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 244-1981; Ord. 630-1979) 
111.572 - License issuance-Contents-Record to be kept. 
    It shall be the duty of the License Clerk, upon payment of the required license fee, to issue to any trustworthy person of the age of eighteen years or older, a license for any of the purposes named in this article. Each license shall express upon its face the time and purpose for which it is issued; the name of the person to whom it is issued; and, if issued for the use of a hall or building, the person to whom it is issued shall be designated as owner, lessee, or manager, as the case may be. Each license shall be signed by the License Clerk and he shall keep a record of all licenses issued by him, which shall state the name of the person to whom such license is granted, the purpose, date, and length of time for which it is issued and the amount of money received therefor. 
111.573 - Reserved seats. 
    No proprietor or manager of, or employee or other person connected with, any theatrical exhibition or other show shall place or cause to be placed any card, article, or designation in, about, or upon any seat within the room or enclosure where such theatrical exhibition or other show is given indicating that such seat has been reserved unless there has been a bona fide sale of each seat. Penalty, see  111.999. 
111.574 - Standing room only signs. 
    No person shall sell or offer for sale at any theatrical exhibition, or other show, tickets of admission to such exhibition or show or, when different rates are charged for tickets of admission to different parts of the house, sell or offer for sale tickets of admission to such different parts of the house after tickets equal to the number of seats in such exhibition or show, or tickets to any part of the house equal to the number of seats in such part of such house, have been sold, without having posted in a conspicuous position at the place of selling such tickets a plainly legible notice stating that in such house, or any part thereof to which tickets are sold, there is standing room only. Penalty, see  111.999. 
111.575 - Nets for trapeze performers. 
    No proprietor or manager of any theater or other public place of amusement shall exhibit or permit to be exhibited therein any entertainment called or known as a trapeze performance unless he provides therein and keeps properly stretched and in place, suitable netting or other adequate protection under the performer to prevent personal injury in case of accident. Penalty, see  111.999. 
111.576 - Obstruction in aisles. 
    No proprietor or manager of, or any employee or other person connected with, any public hall or theater shall put or place, or permit to be put or placed, in any of the aisles or passageways in such public hail or theater, any chair, bench, movable seat, or other obstruction during the time of any show or exhibition therein. Penalty, see  111.999. 
111.577 - Inspection requirements. 
    No license shall be issued until a certificate of approval has been delivered to the License Clerk from: 
A.  The Health Director stating that the premises have been inspected and are in compliance with health regulations in regard to the sanitary conditions; 
B.  The Fire Chief stating that the premises have been inspected and are in compliance with the fire code. 
C.  The Chief of Police stating that the theatrical exhibition or show is in compliance with the laws of the City and state. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 127-1991; Ord. 376-1980; Ord. 630-1979) 
111.578 - Insurance requirements. 
A.  As a condition to the issuance of the licenses provided in  111.570, every person or applicant shall deliver to the License Clerk a certificate of general liability insurance, naming the City as an additional insured and certifying that the applicant has in effect a policy of general liability insurance in the sums of at least the following: 
1.  For any amusement house, haunted house, or fun house, or any other unspecified exhibition of any kind whatsoever licensed under this article, one million dollars combined single limit, for bodily injury or wrongful death and property damage in any one occurrence arising out of the activities or performances which are subject to this license. 
2.  For any circus, show, menagerie, or combination thereof, one million dollars combined single limit for bodily injury or wrongful death and property damage in any one occurrence arising out of the activities or performances which are subject to this license. 
3.  For any theatrical exhibition (live show) or motion picture, one million dollars combined single limit, for bodily injury or wrongful death and property damage in any one occurrence arising out of the activities or performances which are subject to this license. 
B.  Such policies shall be written by an insurance company authorized to write this type of insurance in the State of Ohio, and shall contain a clause obligating the insurance carrier to give thirty days' written notice before the cancellation to the License Clerk. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 884-1988; Ord. 630-1979) 
111.579 - Noncompliance. 
    The Police Chief or the Fire Chief, or their designated officers, shall, without written notice cause the immediate cessation of any activity described in  111.570 which is being conducted without benefit of a City license as required in  111.570 for the reason of improper and illegal operation. Such activities shall remain closed until all provisions of this article have been complied with. Penalty, see  111.999. 
(Ord. 376-1980; Ord. 630-1979) 
111.580 - Crowd control at concerts. 
A.  Definitions. For purposes of this section only, the following terms are defined as follows: 
    "Concert." Any musical performance held in a facility for which at least two thousand tickets are offered to the public. 
    "Facility." Any building or other structure that is wholly or substantially enclosed, including without limitation, a stadium, hall, arena, armory, auditorium, ballroom, exhibition hall, convention center, or music hall. 
    "Person." Includes any entity mentioned in R.C.  51.59(c) who promotes, sponsors, or holds a concert within the city. 
B.  No person shall promote, sponsor, or hold a concert within the City unless the attendance at such concert is as set forth below 
1.  No less than eighty percent of the tickets offered to the public for such concert shall be by reserved seating, with each such ticket numbered and corresponding to a specific seat in the facility in which the concert is held.
